attributes.comment:
I am disturbed to learn that there is a proposal to increase the amount of fees
involved in adopting a child overseas. As an adoptive mother whose youngest
child came from Russia 11 years ago, I know how wonderful adoption overseas
can be for American couples. As a Trade Tower widow, I know what my life would
be like without my children. It is unconscionable for our governement to increase
hardship on these families. Some of these couples will have already gone through
many financially draining years of paying for infertility treatments. This forces
some couples to borrow the money to attempt their overseas adoption. Adoption
is one of the few life choices which is positive for many people. It is good for the
birthparents who cannot raise the child, it is good for the infertile couple desperate
for a child. It is wonderful for the child who would have otherwise grown up without
a family. In many foreign lands, it is a bleak future for childrn like these. It is my
hope that the US will not become an impediment for foreign adoption. There are so
many other ways to balance our budget than on the backs of people like this.
Sincerely, Leslie Dimmling
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Leslie Dimmling
